title: RSC The Merchant of Venice (2016) Live From Stratford
description:
Royal Shakespeare Company The Merchant of Venice (2016)
by William Shakespeare from Opus Arte Productions
presented live at Strattford Upon Avon

Runtime 138 mins  Presented in two parts with act break.

Extra features (13 min.): Telling the story; Setting the stage; 

Cast and creatives

Directed for the stage by Polly Findlay
Directed for the screen by Robin Lough

Portia             Patsy Forran       
Antonio            James Ballard
Bassanio           Jacob Fortune Lloyd
Nerisa             Nadia Albina
Shylock            Makram J. Khoury
Lancelot Gobbo     Tim Samuels

Full cast and crew in the credits

Summary from Wikipedia

Bassanio, a young Venetian of noble rank, wishes to woo the beautiful and wealthy heiress Portia of Belmont. Having squandered his estate, he needs 3,000 ducats to subsidise his expenditures as a suitor. Bassanio approaches his friend Antonio, a wealthy merchant of Venice who has previously and repeatedly bailed him out. Antonio agrees, but since he is cash-poor â€“ his ships and merchandise are busy at sea â€“ he promises to cover a bond if Bassanio can find a lender, so Bassanio turns to the Jewish moneylender Shylock and names Antonio as the loan's guarantor.

My notes

  Included here are the dvd features provided with the disk for this production.  Casting is a particular point of interest.  Makram Khoury is interviewed and is a Palestinian from Isreal.  The set for the RSC is also  profiled in a separate featurette.

  In the my collection at TPB  is another Merchant of Venice.  That one is set in Pre-War Nazi Germany directed by Trevor Nunn.  Both productions have  highlights that make them exceptional.  Watch for the cabaret song in the Trevor Nunn production.  

  As always, these encodes are just a way for those interested to get them for their libraries that others may enjoy them
